title: API Key added for one Indices works for all other indices too.

profile.name: Algolia
profile.about: Hosted search API that delivers instant and relevant results from the first keystroke

vulnerability_information:
Hi,

I created one API key and restricted it to only one index by adding it and gave it right for creating record.
Now this api can be used to add records in other indeces in same account.

Screenshot is attached
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

I created one API key and restricted it to only one index by adding it and gave it right for creating record.
Now this api can be used to add records in other indeces in same account.

Screenshot is attached

activities.message:
If you notice in POST URL 
POST _/1/indexes/**sdfdsf**/batch?x-algolia-api-key=**9a51ba19d31faaf7b50246c69b4bf308**&x-algolia-application-id=FTCHS7XZX2&x-algolia-agent=Algolia%20for%20vanilla%20JavaScript%203.7.5_

I have changed the index name to **sdfdsf** anf api keys used was one enabled for **test** index only.

activities.message: You have renamed the index test to sdfdsf?
activities.markdown_message: You have renamed the index test to sdfdsf?

activities.message: No they are two different indices.... I have also tested it on other indices,,,, **111**and **aaaa**
activities.markdown_message: No they are two different indices.... I have also tested it on other indices,,,, 111and aaaa

activities.message: I invited other user to my account with full access restricted to one index only. But He can make changes to all other indexes, by changing the index name in POST request. Which I think is really dangerous.
activities.markdown_message: I invited other user to my account with full access restricted to one index only. But He can make changes to all other indexes, by changing the index name in POST request. Which I think is really dangerous.

activities.message: I cannot replicate the issue you are describing. I've created new API key with limitation to a single index, performed query on the set index and it worked, then I change the index name and got correctly back 403. Which account are you exactly using? I cannot find the key you have been using anywhere so I cannot verify the actions.
activities.markdown_message: I cannot replicate the issue you are describing. I've created new API key with limitation to a single index, performed query on the set index and it worked, then I change the index name and got correctly back 403. Which account are you exactly using? I cannot find the key you have been using anywhere so I cannot verify the actions.

activities.message:
```
curl -X PUT \
>      -H "X-Algolia-API-Key: 0580d14b1c12e191b078f193b5e0e3ce" \
>      -H "X-Algolia-Application-Id: FTCHS7XZX2" \
>      --data-binary "{
>      \"name\": \"Betty Jane Mccamey\",
>      \"company\": \"Vita Foods Inc.\",
>      \"email\": \"betty@mccamey.com\" }" \
>     "https://FTCHS7XZX2.algolia.net/1/indexes/123/testinsert"

{"message":"Index not allowed with this API key","status":403}
```

What you are showing on your screenshots in manipulation of the query string. Are you also changing the keys in the HTTP headers?
activities.markdown_message:

and index from "test" to "123" or "algolia", which i have newly created.....


POST /1/indexes/algolia/batch?x-algolia-api-key=0580d14b1c12e191b078f193b5e0e3ce&x-algolia-application-id=FTCHS7XZX2&x-algolia-agent=Algolia%20for%20vanilla%20JavaScript%203.7.5 HTTP/1.1

activities.message: I still cannot replicate what you are doing. From the Google Chrome console, can you copy the request as cURL? What you are sending is just a portion of the request

activities.message:
curl "https://c1-in-2.algolianet.com/1/indexes/algolia/batch?x-algolia-api-key=0580d14b1c12e191b078f193b5e0e3ce&x-algolia-application-id=FTCHS7XZX2&x-algolia-agent=Algolia"%"20for"%"20vanilla"%"20JavaScript"%"203.7.5" -H "Origin: https://www.algolia.com" -H "Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate" -H "Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.8" -H "User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/48.0.2564.116 Safari/537.36" -H "content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" -H "accept: application/json" -H "Referer: https://www.algolia.com/explorer" -H "Connection: keep-alive" --data "{""requests"":[{""action"":""addObject"",""body"":{""firstname"":""Jimmie"",""lastname"":""Barninger"",""zip_code"":12345}}]}" --compressed


OR


curl -i -s -k  -X 'POST' \
    -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:42.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/42.0' -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8' -H 'Referer: https://www.algolia.com/explorer' -H 'Origin: https://www.algolia.com' \
    --data-binary $'{\"requests\":[{\"action\":\"addObject\",\"body\":{\"firstname\":\"Jimmie\",\"lastname\":\"Barninger\",\"zip_code\":12345}},{\"action\":\"addObject\",\"body\":{\"firstname\":\"John\",\"lastname\":\"Doe\",\"zip_code\":null}}]}' \
    'https://c1-in-2.algolianet.com/1/indexes/algolia/batch?x-algolia-api-key=0580d14b1c12e191b078f193b5e0e3ce&x-algolia-application-id=FTCHS7XZX2&x-algolia-agent=Algolia%20for%20vanilla%20JavaScript%203.7.5'
